snippet: Federal subsidies will pay the entire monthly cost of some plans being offered in the online marketplaces, a surprising figure that has not gotten much attention, in part because the zero-premium plans come with serious trade-offs.
abstract: Millions of people could qualify for federal subsidies that would pay the entire monthly cost of some health care plans being offered in the online marketplaces set up under President Obama’s health care law; surprising figure has failed to garner widespread attention, in part because the zero-premium plans come with serious trade-offs like high out-of-pocket costs for doctor visits and hospital stays.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and KATIE THOMAS

lead_paragraph: Federal subsidies will pay the entire monthly cost of some plans being offered in the online marketplaces, a surprising figure that has not gotten much attention, in part because the zero-premium plans come with serious trade-offs.

headline.main: Under Health Care Act, Millions Eligible for Free Policies
headline.print_headline: Millions Eligible For Free Policies Under Care Act

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
